title: Bug 49195: Error message is printed when using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service
description: When specifying <Server port='1'> in server.xml, an error message is printed in the catalina.20100427.log: 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.' However, Tomcat still shuts down properly. After printing the message, Catalina.stopServer() performs System.exit(1). It seems that when the service launcher stops Tomcat, Catalina.server is not null.
OB: When using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service, an error message saying 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.' is printed in catalina.20100427.log. However, Tomcat still shuts down properly.
EB: It would be better to use wait(10000) instead of sleep(10000) in StandardServer.await() so that it can be woken by a notifyAll() call, or use the interrupt() call to wake it up (if we know the thread).
